Gubernur Sahkan Kenaikan UMP Sumut 8,51%, Buruh Ancam Aksi
02 Nov 2019, 16:11 by Indra Widyastuti


Gubernur Sahkan Kenaikan UMP Sumut 8,51%, Buruh Ancam Aksi

KBRN, Medan : Elemen buruh di Sumatera Utara yang tergabung dalam Federasi Serikat Pekerja Metal Indonesia Provinsi (FSPMI) Sumut akan melakukan aksi unjukrasa, untuk menolak kenaikan Upah Minimum Provinsi (UMP) Sumut sebesar 8,51 %, yang telah ditandatangani Gubernur Sumut, Edy Rahmayadi.Ketua DPW FSPMI Sumut Willy Agus Utomo mengaku sangat kecewa karena gubernur dinilai memaksakan kenaikan UMP Sumut tanpa meperhatikan kondisi ril kehidupan buruh Sumut."Gubernur tidak memperhatikan kondisi ril buruh Sumut yang dalam kurun waktu 7 tahun terkahir upah buruh di Sumut sudah tertinggal jauh dari daerah lain di Indonesia," katanya, Sabtu (2/11/2019).Willy menuturkan, penolaka FSPMI karena penetapan UMP diduga tidak melalui rapat dewan pengupahan dan juga pertimbangan dari serikat buruh yang hampir semua elemen buruh dapat dipastikan menolak penetapan UMP dengan mengacu pada ketentuan PP 78 tahun 2015."Padahal buruh Sumut meminta harusnya penetapan UMP berdasarkan hasil survei kebutuhan hidup layak (KHL) meliputi sandang, pangan, papan para buruh," ungkapnya.Menurut Willy, UMP Sumut sudah selayaknya naik diatas 15 - 20 % berdasarkan hasil survei KHL terbaru yang menghitung 84 item KHL yakni naik menjadi Rp 2,7 juta - Rp 3 juta."Gubsu terlalu cepat meneken UMP Sumut, seolah mau cari aman saja. Padahal Dewan Pengupahan Nasional sedang merumuskan penghitungan upah buruh berdasarkan KHL yang terbaru digodok oleh dewan pengupahan nasional di Jakarta," ujarnya.Dikatakan Willy, gubernur Edy Rahmayadi sudah dua kali memaksakan UMP dengan PP 78."Ini menandakan program beliau kepada kesejahteraan buruh Sumut tidak sesuai dengan janji janjinya," tegasnya.Willy melanjutkan, nerkaitan dengan hal tersebut, FSPMI Sumut menolak tegas kenaikan UMP Sumut tahun 2020 dan meminta gubernur merevisi kenaikan UMP tersebut."Kami akan melakukan aksi unjuk rasa pada Rabu, 6 November 2019 dengan massa aksi 1000 orang. Dan kami akan wacanakan aksi setiap hari Rabu dan akan terus menggalang massa buruh dan elemen lain untuk aksi bersama melakukan penolakan kenaikan UMP Sumut yang sangat murah itu," pungkasnya.Â

Governor Approves North Sumatra UMP Increase 8.51%, Workers Threaten Action
02 Nov 2019, 16:11 by Indra Widyastuti


Governor Approves North Sumatra UMP Increase 8.51%, Workers Threaten Action

KBRN, Medan: Labor elements in North Sumatra who are members of the North Sumatra Provincial Indonesian Metal Workers Union (FSPMI) will hold demonstrations, to reject the North Sumatra Provincial Minimum Wage (UMP) of 8.51%, signed by the Governor of North Sumatra, Edy Rahmayadi. North Sumatra DPW FSPMI chairman Willy Agus Utomo admitted that he was very disappointed because the governor was considered to have forced the North Sumatra UMP to increase without paying attention to the real conditions of the lives of North Sumatra workers. other regions in Indonesia, "he said, Saturday (11/2/2019). Willy said, the FSPMI's figure was because the stipulation of the UMP was allegedly not through the wage council meeting and also the consideration of the trade unions that almost all elements of the workers could certainly reject the establishment of the UMP by referring to regulation PP 78 of 2015. "Though the North Sumatra workers asked for the establishment of UMP based on the results of a survey of living needs p feasible (KHL) includes clothing, food, shelter for workers, "he said. According to Willy, North Sumatra UMP should rise above 15 - 20% based on the results of the latest KHL survey which counted 84 KHL items, which rose to Rp 2.7 million - Rp. 3 million. "The Governor of North Sumatra signed the North Sumatra UMP too quickly, as if he wanted to find it safe. Whereas the National Wage Council is formulating labor wage calculations based on the latest KHL which is being drafted by the national wage council in Jakarta, "he said. with its promise, "he said. Willy continued, related to this matter, North Sumatra's FSPMI firmly rejected North Sumatra's UMP increase in 2020 and asked the governor to revise the UMP increase." We will hold a demonstration on Wednesday, November 6, 2019 with a mass of 1,000 people . "We will discuss actions every Wednesday and will continue to mobilize the mass of workers and other elements for joint action to reject the very cheap North Sumatra UMP increase," he concluded.
